abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed project consists of the
            construction and equipment of (i) a new secondary teacher
            training school; (ii) additions to the existing Technical
            Institute of Agriculture; and (iii) 15 new general secondary
            schools. The secondary teacher training school would provide
            700 new places and contribute about 85 percent of the new
            and 50 percent of the retrained personnel required to have a
            fully qualified secondary teacher force by 1980. The new
            secondary schools would provide for 13,400 student places
            and revised curricula which would reflect the demand for
            skills of different kinds. The expansion of the Technical
            Institute of Agriculture would raise its places to 600,
            triple the present output at the skilled worker level and
            graduate annually 80 at the technician level.
